page.title: 05Farming in the Cowtons
page.content: Mixed farming is carried out in the Cowtons area. One large farm is arable only, but the majority have livestock also. As well as winter wheat and barley, oil-seed rape is now a very profitable crop. Beef cattle are now commonplace. Young bulls are fed indoors until they are 12 months old and sold for beef. Only a few farms are dairy farms. They have herds of approx. 80 cows, all milk goes by bulk tanker to the milk marketing board. The majority either suckle calves with cows (2-3 per cow), or calves are fed milk substitutes. Most go for slaughter at 18 months to 2 years old. Market gardening is carried out at Pepper Arden Farms. Customers may go to pick their own fruit (eg: straw- berries). There is a Ross Poultry broiler breeder farm with 8000 birds in North Cowton.
